summary: This document is an email chain between defense attorneys from WilmerHale (representing JPMorgan) and a federal prosecutor regarding the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell. The emails primarily concern scheduling meetings and calls to discuss identifying a JPMorgan witness for trial and obtaining a trial subpoena.

persons.name: Allison Stoddart
persons.context: Attorney at WilmerHale law firm, corresponding with the prosecution to schedule meetings and discuss obtaining a trial subpoena for a JPMorgan witness.

persons.name: Alison
persons.context: Federal prosecutor for the Southern District of New York handling the Ghislaine Maxwell case, communicating with defense counsel about trial witness logistics and scheduling.

persons.name: Anjan Sahni
persons.context: Attorney at WilmerHale law firm, copied on the email correspondence regarding the Maxwell case and JPMorgan witness matters.

persons.name: Pat McHugh
persons.context: Individual whom the defense team wishes to include in a call with the prosecution; appears to be associated with the defense or JPMorgan side.

persons.name: Maurene
persons.context: Named as a recipient in one email from Allison Stoddart regarding the JPMorgan witness subpoena.

persons.name: Lara
persons.context: Named as a recipient in one email from Allison Stoddart regarding the JPMorgan witness subpoena.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The accused in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, which is the subject of the legal correspondence.

connections.description: Defense attorney and prosecutor communicating to coordinate on trial logistics, specifically regarding a JPMorgan witness.
Attorneys at the same law firm (WilmerHale) working together on the JPMorgan defense team for the Maxwell case.
Stoddart is arranging calls that include Pat McHugh, indicating a working relationship, likely within the defense team or JPMorgan.
Prosecutor corresponding with defense attorney Sahni, who is copied on the emails.

events.title: Jury Selection for Maxwell Trial
events.description: Mentioned as occurring in November 2021, making scheduling difficult for the prosecution.

events.title: Request for Trial Subpoena to JPMorgan
events.description: Defense attorney Allison Stoddart requests the prosecution provide a trial appearance subpoena for a JPMorgan witness.

events.title: Prosecution Sends Draft Exhibits
events.description: Prosecutor Alison sends draft exhibits to facilitate conversation about identifying a JPMorgan witness.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
7 World Trade Center, 250 Greenwich Street, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The emails reveal coordination between JPMorgan's defense team at WilmerHale and the prosecution in the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case regarding a trial witness from JPMorgan.
The defense is actively seeking a trial subpoena from the prosecution for a JPMorgan witness, indicating JPMorgan's involvement is a subject of the trial proceedings.
Scheduling is complicated by ongoing jury selection for the Maxwell trial in November 2021, leading to proposed evening and weekend meetings.
The correspondence shows the use of external email senders and sensitivity to scheduling around court appearances.
